field.label: Enable c-icap service
field.help: This will activate the c-icap service.

field.label: Timeout
field.help: The time in seconds after which a connection without activity can be cancelled.

field.label: Max keepalive requests
field.help: The maximum number of requests can be served by one connection

field.label: Max keepalive timeout
field.help: The maximum time in seconds waiting for a new request before a connection will be closed.

field.label: Start servers
field.help: The initial number of server processes. Each server process generates a number of threads, which serve the requests.

field.label: Max servers
field.help: The maximum allowed number of server processes.

field.label: Min spare threads
field.help: If the number of the available threads is less than number, the c-icap server starts a new child.

field.label: Max spare threads
field.help: If the number of the available threads is more than number then the c-icap server kills a child.

field.label: Threads per child
field.help: The number of threads per child process.

field.label: Max requests per child
field.help: The maximum number of requests that a child process can serve. After this number has been reached, process dies.

field.label: Listen address
field.help: Network address that the c-icap server uses to listen to requests.

field.label: Server admin
field.help: The Administrator of this server. Used when displaying information about this server.

field.label: Servername
field.help: A name for this server. Used when displaying information about this server (logs, info service, etc).

field.label: Enable access logging
field.help: This will enable logging of access log.

field.label: Use c-icap with local squid
field.help: This will allow to take settings user name from local squid
